page.title: 18TRAFFIC PROBLEMS IN BIBURY
page.content: Most weekdays there are over 200 vehicles an hour going along the A433. Of these about 30 are lorries and heavy vehicles. The road wasn't built four such traffic as it has many dangerous corners and suddenly narrows through the village. The old turnpike junctions are complicated as 5 roads meet at the Pike and 6 roads at Ready Token. The bridge and corner by the Swan Hotel are particularly hazardous because lorries and buses have to take up both sides of the road to negotiate the bend. The main street and bridge are always busy during the summer with tourists. In the afternoons and at weekend all available parking spaces in the village centre are full of cars and pedestrians making the roads even more dangerous for visitors and locals alike.
